OriginalSource.Comment: Fixed line formatting of labels in parentheses for "(moderate penetrance)" and "(high penetrance)"
Clearer image recreated by Terese - original image provided by Genetics Board Member. Permissions not required.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Graph shows relative risk on the x-axis and allele frequency on the y-axis. A line depicts the general finding of a low relative risk associated with common, low-penetrance genetic variants and a higher relative risk associated with rare, high-penetrance genetic variants.

Captions.MediaCaption: Genetic architecture of cancer risk. This graph depicts the general finding of a low relative risk associated with common, low-penetrance genetic variants, such as single-nucleotide polymorphisms identified in genome-wide association studies, and a higher relative risk associated with rare, high-penetrance genetic variants, such as mutations in the BRCA1/ BRCA2 genes associated with hereditary breast and ovarian cancer and the mismatch repair genes associated with Lynch syndrome.

ProposedUse.Summary: Genetics of Breast and Gynecologic Cancers

ProcessingStatus.Comment: Added Allele Freq and RR of Cancer.jpg
